intro: Hieracium elvdalense, commonly known as the Elvdalen hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and along riverbanks. It has basal leaves that are usually heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and protected species in certain regions.
